page.title: 05 BIRDWATCHING
page.content: {Birdwatching in Hamworth Ornithologists in the area enjoy the sighting of a large variety of birds. Especially enjoyed are the species associated with{estuaries, bays and other water spaces. The area has large stretches of water including {Lytchett Bay and Holes Bay. The{water type species}to be found include waders, divers, wildfowl and seabirds. Amongst the{wildfowl}to be seen are mute swans, Canada geese, shellducks, mallards, tufted ducks and teal. The{waders, divers and grebes to be seen are the redshank, lapwings, snipe, woodcock, curlew, oyster catchers, ringed plover; the ringed plover is to be seen in the winter. There are also quite a few{seabirds about the area such as gulls, terns and cormorants. Gannets visit the area in winter.
